title: Re: Adplug... As a seperate program?
content:
My XMMS plugin is open source, so you can do whatever you want with it as long as you release the source code of your changes. If you want to change the samplerate it's defined in src/global.h, so just change it there and recompile (sorry, I couldn't be bothered with a user interface.) I haven't fully tested that though, so if you get noise out of your speakers after changing it let me know.

@DaVince: The old method of playing MIDIs (starting with the early Sound Blaster cards under DOS, and then continuing on to Windows) was to play MIDI files through the OPL synth. It's difficult to do that today, because it sounded so bad (compared to a wavetable synth) that everyone tried to avoid it. Adplug can do it, and if you want I can post the original SB16 'play' utility that will play MIDIs in DOSBox through the OPL synth (which you can then capture to .wav or .dro) It uses different MIDI patches to the Windows synth, so it sounds different again.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

content:
Yep, it works fine for me so I've stopped coding on it now [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] The next version will be integrated with my game editor, which after all, was the point of the plugin in the first place (proof of concept.)

Here's the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/sb16pnp.zip]Sound Blaster 16 PnP installation[/url]. There are a bunch of folders, just run INSTALL.EXE in each folder within DOSBox and it'll ask where you want it installed - C:\SB16 is the norm. If it asks for a Windows directory you can make one up or just opt not to install the Windows stuff (whatever you do don't point it at your *real* Windows install, it's meant for Win3.1 and will probably break something on a modern version.)

Once it's done it'll modify autoexec.bat to set some environment variables (BLASTER and SOUND are the important ones, the DOSBox BLASTER default is missing "P330" from the end), these must exist for stuff to work. If all is well, you can "cd\sb16" and then "play samples\*.mid" to see if it worked.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]
